channel.title: [317]Creating Highscores Via MySQL[317]
channel.description:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,413569.0.html]508 HighScores Tutorial[/url]
[b]Description:[/b] How to set up real highscores from http address [b]Difficulty:[/b] About 5/10 [b]Assumed Knowledge:[/b] How to use CTRL+F button, how to download, paste, copy, etc..
[b]Tested Server(s):[/b] DeltaScape and Project Insanity(With minor adjustments) [b]Files/Classes Modified:[/b] Client.java, SQL.java, Highscores.php, Mysql.php, Skills.php, Personal.php
[hr]
[u][b]Updates[/b][/u] Highscore Template Updated To Match Jagex's -March 12, 2010 Tutorial re-written - June 25, 2010
[hr]
NOTE: If you have a newer version of XAMPP, Uninstall it. NOTE: The root password is not root. Its not set. You must set it as shown later.
[size=12pt][b][font=verdana]Chapter 1 - XAMPP Setup[/font][/b][/size] [b]Step one:[/b] Download XAMPP from the following link http://www.oldapps.com/xampp.php?old_xampp=44?download
[b] Step two:[/b] Once you have downloaded XAMPP, run the application file and proceed to install XAMPP. [b]1.[/b] Select your language.
[IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture.png[/img]
[b]2.[/b] Select your directory. (C:\xampp\ by default)
[IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture2-1.png[/img]
[b]3.[/b] Select to install both Apache and MySQL services.
[IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture3.png[/img]
[b]4.[/b] Wait for everything to install, when prompted to start control panel, click yes.
The control panel shows you whats going on with XAMPP, it will show you if Apache and MySQL are running(If they are not, please click the start button next to both of them) If a message comes up saying one of the services is not installed, click the checkbox next to that service to install it. [IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture4.png[/img]
[b]Step three:[/b] Once all of that is up and running go to http://localhost/security/xamppsecurity.php
Here we will set up the password for MySQL. For some odd reason, this page likes to be German, regardless of what language you installed in. If not, lucky you, below is a translation.
Akuelles Passwort: (current password) Neues Passwort: (new password) Wiederhole neues Passwort: (confirm new password) The current password is "" After filling that out click "Passwort andern" (change password)
[IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture6.png[/img]
Alright, XAMPP is now set up on your computer, lets move on.
[hr]
[size=12pt][b][font=verdana]Chapter 2 - Highscores[/font][/b][/size] Now that XAMPP is installed we can start on the Highscore files.
[b]Step 1:[/b] Download the highscores folder [URL=http://up.ht/SzfxY0]highscores.rar - 527 KB[/URL] ([url=http://azaruth.com/archives/highscores.rar]mirror 1[/url])
[b]Step 2:[/b] Open the highscores folder you downloaded you should have the following files Com Folder - MySQL Classes Made By Sun Microsystems [b](X)[/b]Assets Folder - Contains Images [b](X)[/b]Functions.php - Contains all PHP Functions [b](X)[/b]Mysql.php - Contains Database and Site Information [b](X)[/b]Highscores.php - Main Page of Highscores Hiscore.sql - Contains SQL Database Entry [b](X)[/b]Personal.php - Personal Pages For Specific Player [b](X)[/b]RS_Styles.css - Keep it in your highscores folder... :| [b](X)[/b]Skills.php - Skill Page for Each Skill SQL.java - Java file that connects your server to the MySQL database
Navigate to the xampp folder (C:\xampp\). Find the folder that says "htdocs", open it and create a new folder called "highscores" Move the files marked with [b](X)[/b] from above into this new folder.
[b]Step 3:[/b] Open mysql.php and find the line [code]<?php // MYSQL mysql_connect('localhost', 'root', 'PASSWORD'); mysql_select_db('highscores');[/code]
Edit the username and password so that it matches the one you set up so it should look like this [code]<?php // MYSQL mysql_connect('localhost', 'root', 'yourpassword'); mysql_select_db('highscores');[/code]
Now save mysql.php and close it.
Every file in that highscores folder is bound to localhost, meaning that only you can view it from your computer. To make it available to everybody, you need to open every PHP file and change localhost to your IP address.
[b]NOTE:[/b] There are three instances of [i]localhost[/i] in mysql.php, don't change the first one.
[b]Step 4:[/b] Open the XAMPP control panel and click the MySQL admin button. Enter your username and password, you will be redirected to a different page.
In the middle of page you see white boxes, and there should be a box with text "create database". type in that box "highscores" and press "create". Now you need to add tables, there are two options. Option one - Click the import button at the top of the page and press "browse". Navigate to the highscores folder, and there is a file called hiscore.sql select it. Option two - Click the SQL button at the top of the page, open hiscore.sql from the highscores folder, copy its content and paste it into the text box on the page.
Now that is done, Test your connection by going to http://localhost/highscores/highscores.php
[hr]
[size=12pt][b][font=verdana]Chapter 3 - Server sided[/font][/b][/size] [b]Step 1:[/b] Open the highscores files you downloaded again and add the "com" folder as well as "sql.java" into your server files.
[b]Step 2:[/b] Than open SQL.java and search for this [code=Java] public static void createConnection() { try { Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance(); con = DriverManager.getConnection( "jdbc:mysql://localhost/highscore", "USERNAME", "PASSWORD"); stmt = con.createStatement(); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }[/code]
Once again you need to edit the username and password just like last time, save and compile.
[b]Step 3:[/b] Now we need to create a saving method so that it updates when players log out. Fist open server class (server.java) and in the run method [code=Java]public void run()[/code] Add: [code=Java]SQL.createConnection();[/code]
Open client.java and find your logout method. [code]public void logout() {[/code] Add
[code] SQL.saveHighScore(this); [/code] Save and compile and you are done adding highscores
[size=12pt][b][font=verdana]Project Insanity Information[/font][/b][/size]
Put SQL class in the util folder, in SQL class change [i]saveHighScore(client clientToSave)[/i] to [i]saveHighScore(Client clientToSave)[/i]
Project Insanity's Server class doesn't have a run method, so put [i]SQL.createConnection();[/i] in the main method [code=Java]public static void main(java.lang.String args[])[/code]
At the top of SQL class you import Client class [code=Java]import server.model.players.Client;[/code] And at the top of Client class and Server class import SQL class [code=Java]import server.util.SQL;[/code]
You also have to declare SQL's package (In SQL class) [code=Java]package server.util;[/code]
To test this go to http://localhost/highscores/highscores.php For others to see your highscores you must portforward on port 80 They go to http://Yourserverip/highscores/highscores.php Note: I don't believe Utorrent can be used to open port 80.
[IMG]http://i373.photobucket.com/albums/oo176/Ranger_Owns/Capture-1.png[/img]
[b]Please note:[/b] Any questions regarding remote MySQL connections and/or web hosting problem should be directed towards the web host you're using.
[b]Credits:[/b] Me Segadora Jagex

item.dc:creator: @jerkpar jerkpar
item.description:
@jerkpar wrote:

I get an error when a player logs out! help! Please!

com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Out of range value for column ‘lvl’ at row 1
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4094)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4028)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2490)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2651)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2677)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1748)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1665)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.rs2.util.sql.SQL.query(SQL.java:30)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.rs2.util.sql.SQL.saveHighScore(SQL.java:143)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.rs2.model.players.Player.logout(Player.java:1665)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.rs2.Server.cycle(Server.java:364)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at com.rs2.Server.run(Server.java:223)
[7/28/14 10:29 AM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

item.title: [317]Creating Highscores Via MySQL[317]
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

speady888888:

I did the tut with XAMMP, all ports are forwarded correctly, and when I go to the http://myip/highscores/highscores.php link with my correct server ip, no players are showing up in the highscores, and none are appearing after logging out. Please Help

That is usually indicative of a fault with XAMPP but I cannot elaborate more on that. In addition to that the MySQL extentsion is deprecated in PHP 5, I need to rewrite just about everything. MySQL needs to be replaced with MySQLi, most of the PHP is rudimentary at best, and the Java is just awful. Once upon a time this was the only tutorial to get hiscores but unfortunately I created it with very limited knowledge. I have a greater understanding of all aspects of everything this tutorial has I just have not found the time to rewrite it.

This tutorial needs to be reworked but unfortunately this tutorial doesn’t pay bills so it’s not very high on my todo list, sorry. :\

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Revamp_dis_Shit Revamp dis Shit
item.description:
@Revamp_dis_Shit wrote:

I’m having issues with this as well… my problem is only overall level will show…and only when I check my highscores through local host…

Also i’m really not sure on what to put as my ip…I’ve tried my server ip, my actual ip, my forums url, a webhost that i signed up for just to see if it would work, etc…

Port 80 should be opened…considering when a new player logs in and then out they save immediately to the highscores.

Yet while in the process of finding a fix to get the highscores working for other players and making the other skill levels show…I messed up something after dropping the first highscores database (hoping that’d be the problem) and re-importing it…so now no players show up/update on the highscores, even after re-logging.

Source: Allstar

item.title: [317]Creating Highscores Via MySQL[317]
item.dc:creator: @RS_From_The_00s RS From The 00s
item.description:
@RS_From_The_00s wrote:

I have the com folder in my server files. It’s worked in the past, anyone know why it wouldn’t be recognising it? jdk version 7.1.0_45.

try {
			Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
			con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://ipaddress/highscores","user","pass");
			stmt = con.createStatement();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

I’ve put it in the src folder, I’ve put it in the same package as the SQL connection file, I’ve linked it as a source folder, and I’ve attempted to add it as a library but it’s not a JUnit, User, Maven or JRE Library folder so it wouldn’t link.

Any help would be appreciated please.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Creating Highscores Via MySQL[317]
item.dc:creator: @Drimestic_Comics Drimestic Comics
item.description:
@Drimestic_Comics wrote:

this is what I found, and use.

/*
 * Programmed by: Mr.Craley AP Computer Science || 2009
 *
 * Creates a Sql Connection correctly, With the latest Java.
 * @param
 *             The Tick.
 */
public static void sqlConnection(Client client, int ticks) {
    Sql.startSqlConnection(True);
        If (Sql.Connected) {
            System.out.println("Mysql has connected to your game.");
            Sql.connectToPORT(True);
            Sql.connectTODB(True);
        } else {
            System.out.println("Unable to connect to your mysql port.");
            reconnectSql();
        }
/*
 * This is the most confusing part, the mysql has to create some sort of ticks the more the better.
 */
     int ticks as Decimal;
 Sql.sendPacket(23);
ticks = PlayerHandler.playersOnline() * Server.FPS - Server.CleanProcess
 Sql.sendTicks(ticks);
While (!Client.ServerShutDown) {
 Sql.process(ticks);
}
